p: No significant difference was seen in the frequency of rash in both groups. The presence of comparatively lower systolic pressures in DEN-V and increased levels of haematocrit likely reflect plasma leakage resulting from increased vascular permeability and third spacing. [ 18]. Fluid replacement and supportive management was required more frequently in DEN-V patients, a finding in concordance with other reports from Pakistan [ 23, 24] and other parts of dengue endemic region [ 1, 25].
